comment.author: 70251312@N00
comment._content:
A Bain/LOC closeup photo of President Wilson in the carriage:
[http://www.flickr.com/photos/library_of_congress/5208802207/]
Another photo of New York City Mayor John Purroy Mitchel with U. S. President Woodrow Wilson, at NYC rites for the Veracruz dead, May 11, 1914:
[http://www.flickr.com/photos/library_of_congress/5517542032/]
Here's yet another, posted to Flickr on April 29, 2011:
[http://www.flickr.com/photos/library_of_congress/5669482743/in/photostream]
And a photo showing Mayor Mitchel alone:
[http://www.flickr.com/photos/library_of_congress/5517542144/in/photostream/]

comment.author: 8623220@N02
comment._content: Wystan -- Patched now (one "l"); we'll comb the database source records again and get a better handle on the mayor's name. -- Helena

comment.author: 35072786@N08
comment._content: Wystan: Thanks for making the connection between these photos of the NYC ceremonies for the Veracruz dead. We will add more information when we update.

comment.author: 70251312@N00
comment._content: May 11, 1914: the National Memorial Service for 17 U. S. sailors killed in April at Vera Cruz. Story in the New York Times, 5/11/14: query.nytimes.com/mem/archive-free/pdf?res=940CE3DB173AE6...

comment.author: 34904489@N07
comment._content: Wystan, Thanks for your efforts with the numerous photographs which document the National Memorial Service of May 11, 1914. We will be able to better link the related images and expand the descriptions, including the addition of a date where one is not yet included. We will add Mr. Tumulty to this description as well. He is identified as Wilson's secretary in this photograph from one of our other collections.
